result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Douglas Welsch

10:10 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris,  Defendant Christopher Douglas Welsch in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Christopher Douglas Welsch.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF74 & 22CF185.  Court reviews file and notes off record discussions with attorneys. Atty Harrelson states DE is in custody and asks to schedule trial, no longer planning to continue to plea today. Court schedules trial and FPT dates. State requests to schedule both files for the JT.  Court confirms both will be scheduled as JT. Adjourned at 10:12 AM. bph

03:00 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel  ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Christopher Douglas Welsch appeared from jail.  INCLUDES: 22CF185 and 22CF74.  Court calls 22CF185:  S/T Deputy Dillon Olson, SCSO; direct by Atty Ellenwood.Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Harrelson.  Atty Ellenwood argues bindover, Atty Harrelson reserves. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. The State will not be filing any other charges on this case and Information will mirror the complaint.  Atty would like to proceed with ARGN. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Atty Harrelson states DE has been revoked on another matter and will be going to prison for 2 years, 8 mo.  Bond continues in form and amount on both matters. Adjourned:  3:13 pm  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Status conference on February 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, S.B. or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his bond/bail that he may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
